newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt sells 55 Naphtha cargoes over six months.
newsitem.headline: Egypt sells 55 Naphtha cargoes over six months.

text.p: The state's Egyptian General Petroleum Corp (EGPC) sold Vitol SA 24 cargoes of Suez naphtha at Average Mediterranean Quotes +$18.53 a tonne fob Med, a Cairo-based trader said on Wednesday.
The cargoes averaged 30,000 tonnes each, added the trader, who declined to be named.
EGPC made the award on Monday, he added.
It also sold 31 cargoes of Alexandria naphtha to a variety of customers over the same time period at differing prices around fob Med +$9/T, traders in Cairo and London said.
The companies awarded the cargoes were:
EGPC had tendered for 36 cargoes but it did not award the remaining five, added the trader, who declined to be named. It is expected to tender again but has not set a date for this.
The trader said Alexandria naphtha usually fetched a higher price than Suez naphtha, sold on Monday at +$18.53, but this time demand from the Far East reversed the pattern.
Egypt usually sells to Europe and the Suez naphtha has to pay tolls for going through the Suez Canal.
